name: Glasgow Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott in Glasgow for the second time, this time for our anniversary in September. We stayed using the Tesco Clubcard rate so wasn't really expecting a great room, but after we explained that it was our anniversary they upgraded us free of charge to an Executive Room.
reviews.title: Lovely anniversary stay

reviews.text: The hotel is located slightly out of the centre (next to the motorway but you cant hear the noise from the room.) We walked into town a few times, only took 10 minutes. We got a taxi back from the city center one evening and it cost about £4. There is a Tesco Metro a block or two away from the hotel which is open until late.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean, staff really helpful and friendly. We visited the spa twice and changing rooms were clean each time. Breakfast was included in our rate and the selection was great - everything from fresh fruit and yogurts to full cooked breakfast and even porridge with whisky! Breakfast on a Saturday is served up to 12noon which is nice for a lazy weekend visit.
reviews.title: Average!

reviews.text: Standard Marriot, rooms on the small side, service normal. All ok
reviews.title: An excellent stay

reviews.text: The Marriot is a city centre hotel, ideal for sightseeing, but showing its age. It is easy to reach by car and has ample parking space (at £8 per night). I was there on a Friday night and it was very busy. Service at the bar was slow! Rooms are well enough furnished, bathrooms are adequate. Breakfast is good.
reviews.title: Friday special deal
it was okay
reviews.text: Stayed here one night before heading to the airport. Had 2 rooms. After arriving from Edinburgh's train station, we were told that the hotel was a short distance away. As such, we decided to walk to the hotel -- big mistake. if you want a hotel near the center of town, this hotel is not it. It is located in the middle of no where and the surroundings look a bit dicey. Upon arrival at the hotel, we had to wait for the desk staff to finish their private conversations before they waited on us. Given that we were tired, we just wanted to get to our rooms. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable, but I'm glad that we only stayed one night as the staff seemed a bit aloof. Pool was very small.

I would like to take this opportunity to express a special thanks to Mr. Martin Roberts who has been in attendance at the 12th floor Executive Lounge. He is the kindest, most cordial and accomadating person I have ever met in a Hotel Club room venue. He should be offered an opportunity to be involved with customer relations or raised to a management position in way of customer services.
reviews.title: Special thanks and recognition

reviews.text: For reference:
reviews.title: Glasgow Marriott we will be back!!

reviews.title: Will be back! Great Location and Familiar Marriott accommodations and Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel with very friendly and courteous staff. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and the food and service where outstanding.
reviews.title: Functional hotel, good location

reviews.text: Stayed at Glasgow Marriott for 1 night as my granddaughter had been nominated for an award. The rooms were spacious and the bed very comfortable. Sound proofing is excellent as the hotel is situated next to M8 motorway but no traffic sound at all. Bar is a bit pricey but probably on a par with city centre outlets.
reviews.title: Big Hearted Awards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best service I have ever had in a hotel - did not meet a single unhappy, rude or unhelpful staff member.
reviews.title: night away

reviews.text: Although the spa treatment centre is not part of the hotel (which is why I have left the rating as 5 stars) it is worth mentioning that it was poor, over priced treatments and staff that do not help you feel relaxed - the lady i had moaned about how busy she was through out my massage. not good at all. should have spent my money in the bar instead!
reviews.title: No Surprises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Marriot while on a weeks business in Scotland.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marrriot Glasgow is a little tired on the outside and could maybe do with some upgrading but that aside it's still an excellent business hotel with everything on offer that you'd need. A nice room with a super-comfy bed and great breakfast as well as good leisure facilities was what was needed and it's what we got.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: If you are used to staying in Marriott hotels than there are no suprises here .Rooms are very clean and comfortable and almost identical to other Marriotts I have stayed in.Customer service was excellent even though the hotel was full we had no long waits.
reviews.title: Only one minor complaint
Lovely friendly hotel
reviews.text: Cant comment on Breakfast as we were room only

Good clean hotel, my room was very spacious and had everything you need. It close to main road but cant hear any noise. Breakfast was buffet style but very nice and fresh. My only issue - what no free wireless!!
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a good rate for this standard of city center hotel. Room good size and very appointed and comfortable. Did not eat in until breakfast which was as you expect in a chain of this type but quite acceptable.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: Staff very polite and informative. One niggle - parking charge is an add on to the room rate. Never had this before and it should either be included or made aware of at time of booking.
reviews.title: Happy stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located center of the city which is very easy access for shopping malls and the hotels. 15min drive from airport.Checkin staffs are fast and helpful attitude to explain the side seen and the shopping areas. Free internet was provided. Rooms are tidy and clean. Good room set upand many tv channel’s were available. The lounge was very good, good red wines were served even the breakfast was good standard. Hotel may work on the bed comfort , Over all, wonderful stay
reviews.title: Pay for WiFi - really??

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our CIE tour of Scotland. We arrived very early in the morning and were very happy that a room was ready for us, even if it was a tiny, handicap accessible room with one double bed (yes, DOUBLE) and a great view of the service entrance and dumpsters. The room was very clean, but noisy due to the dumpsters and the conference rooms that were located all around our room. But that's why we always bring earplugs when we travel. Nice tea setup with little cookies, plus wine glasses and a corkscrew ( but no wine that we could find :) ) The breakfast was fantastic. That evening we realized our TV didn't work, so we mentioned it at reception when we were coming back from dinner. They said they'd send a maintenance guy up, and we literally had just got back to our room when he arrived! Very impressed with that.
reviews.title: Most uncomfortable bed ever!

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel as part of our trip around Scotland and booked it for a really cheap rate through Hotwire. Arrived early (around lunch) but no problem to check in. Parking has plenty of space and was inexpensive for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Typical Marriott - a little walk from the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard is typically Marriott with a really comfy bed, huge bathroom and a well working airconditon. The windows were really dirty and could use some cleaning. Also they still impose high charges for inroom internet use (i prefer hotels with free wifi).
reviews.title: Brilliant will stay again

reviews.text: Location is a little outside the action in a typical quite office area and a 15 minute walk to the main shopping and restaurant areas.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and food

reviews.text: Overall value for money for the price we paid but i would prefer other hotels if i had to pay the full rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel, would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel on at least 4 occassions and thought that I should write a review this time. As always the service was great from check in to check out. I used the pool this stay and found it slightly small but clean and the sauna and steam room were brilliant. The hotel was probably the busiest that I have ever seen it but it never posed a problem. I did have to wait for breakfast one day but only for 3 or 4 minutes. There was a warning printed up that breakfast would be very busy the next day during perticular hours so we accepted this and went earlier and got straight in. The hotel is located about 10-15 minutes walk from the central train station and the same from the SECC which we found ideal.
reviews.title: Safe choice
This is a business hotel. Nothing more
reviews.text: This is an entirely adequate business hotel. It's a bland but reliable Marriott. The staff are courteous, the rooms are comfortable without being swish, everything works, it's clean and tidy, and the breakfast is good. The hotel's a short walk from Central station and the west end. I'd come here again on business, but not with my family.

reviews.title: Brilliant :)
reviews.text: We are just back from a stay here & we had a fab time. The hotel is next to an underground station which is handy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 1pm & both the rooms booked were ready so we could check in.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, But It's the Customer Service that Makes the Place
Full marks to the staff.
reviews.text: We had 2 lovely rooms on the 9th floor cosy and spaceous. We didn't eat an evening meal at the hotel but we had drinks which were a average priced. Breakfast is a buffet style which was really yummy. Good choice & friendly staff. We will be back next time we are in Glasgow ;)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best service imaginable, with extra kudos for Margaret Boudraa at the front desk. I typically don't sleep well the night before a flight and all I wanted to do was lock myself into the business center, but Margaret wouldn't hear of it. Instead, she tried to help me sort out all of my concerns about driving to the airport, finding gas enroute and getting to the airport on time. Rooms are clean, quiet and private. Beds are comfortable. Fitness facility is impressive. Fitness staff were very kind and invited me to join one of their exercise classes. WIFI is solid. Hotel is a short 10 minute walk from shops and restaurants and an easy 20 minutes to Glasgow International. That said, it's the hotel staff that really make the place worth the stay.
reviews.title: OK for the money

reviews.text: This property was an interim stop for our first night in Scotland. We flew into Glasgow airport and followed the M8 into town. The hotel is visible from the motorway, but getting to it proved a challenge, I chalk that more to my GPS and not the hotel itself. The GPS kept telling me to take the next ramp which did not lead me to the hotel (even though it was right there) but back on the M8 which got frustrating after 3 tries. I finally shut off the GPS and used some common sense to get into the hotel. The main entrance is a bit confusing as there is a parking garage directly in the entrance road, but the hotel parking lot is actually around the back of the hotel. We finally parked, and made our way to the front desk. This would have been better if they had a parking lot entrance, but I didn't see any, just lucky it wasn't raining. The check in was quick and easy, the hotel granted our early check-in request (promised but not guaranteed) which is a big help if you are arriving from the US and can't sleep on the plane.. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Our room was comfortable and provided all the amenities we needed. The Breakfast buffet was as complete as you could want with plenty of hot and cold choices. The location is a bit out of the main downtown area, but still in walking distance to shopping and restaurants. All in all, this was a good choice. My only complaint would be that I do not like to pay for parking on top of the room rate, but research showed that almost all the hotels in Glasgow charge (as in most major cities), and many do not have onsite parking, so it wasn't out of the ordinary, and of course a parking lot entrance would have been nice.
reviews.title: A reliable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night as part of a long weekend trip to Scotland.
reviews.title: Comfortable, pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was smooth, although there was a queue ( prob 10 wait ) at 3.30 in the afternnon ( Sat )
reviews.title: Not as nice as the Edinburgh Marriott

reviews.text: Room and bathroom both spotlessly clean. Bed comfortable, especially the pillows - which is generally the thing I find most uncomfortable in hotels- we had room overlooking the rear ( carpark) there was some traffic noise, but given the hotels central location this was only to be expected.
reviews.title: Sheer luxury! Wish we could have stayed more than 2 nights"

reviews.text: We ate out in the evening- Mr. Singhs Indian restaurant, which I would def recommend- but did have breakfast in the hotel Sun moening. It was well staffed and plentiful, everything you would expect with regard to choice and hot food both fresh and hot.
reviews.title: Comfy beds, a walk out of town, no good if u don't like lifts!

reviews.text: This was our first hotel in Scotland, after many days of touring in Ireland. The loby was very welcoming and our room very nice and comfortable. We traveled with two other couples and were in a day before starting a CIE tour of Scotland and England. We all needed to do laundry! We wanted to do our own laundry ourselves so we gathered in the lobby to check our options. This is when we first met Bob the concierge. He was a lifesaver! He gave us information regarding a local launderette, pubs in the area and showed us tbe nearest ATM location. So we loaded up our suitcases with our dirty laundry and Bob helped us get a cab. What fun! Part of us manned the machine with the help of a very nice woman who ran the launderette and the others walked to a local coffee shop..they brought us some coffee and tea..great fun in Glasgow. That evening we needed dinner and wanted to walk around a bit. Again, Bob to the rescue! We were directed to a fantastic Italian resaurant! We had a great Italian meal in the heart of Glasgow!
reviews.title: outstanding!

reviews.text: The Marriott also has a beauitful gift shop. It's small but packed witn lovely items. I found the perfect dress for my granddaughter! The food in the lounge was excellent and we all enjoyed a nice lunch. Our breakfasts both mornings were first class!
reviews.title: Excellent value for money
Marriott is marvellous!
reviews.text: All in all we enjoyed our two nights at this hotel. It gave us an excellent first impression of Scotland!

We had a excellent stay here and would return again. Very happy with service And price. Staff are helpful great location . Lovely views and all round great . I would recommend anyone to try this place
reviews.title: £8 Parking rip off

reviews.text: For anyone travelling from the south this could not be better as the slip road of the M8 motorway finds one at the front entrance to the hotel. I always find a polite welcome at any Marriott and with a minimum of delay you are soon settling into your room and I have yet to find fault in terms of comfort and cleanliness. High standard is the norm and although the price may be above average it is well worth paying to find consistency at their hotels wherever you are. It is a pity that unlike most hotels in UK they do not include breakfast in the price.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

description: Set in a bustling, cosmopolitan city with a renowned business centre and prestigious shopping, the Glasgow Marriott Hotel puts you in the heart of it all. Our luxury hotel is a five-minute stroll to nightlife, the SECC and one of the best shopping areas outside London. Perfect for business or leisure, the Marriott offers air-conditioned rooms, wireless Internet throughout the hotel, and 12 conference rooms, which can accommodate up to 550 guests for a dinner reception.
